abstract: Charles Tendell, Iraq War veteran and news media commentator, confirms that he is the owner of Hacker's List, controversial site that allows people to anonymously hire hackers for private work; remain unclear whether site will emerge as legitimate business, and whether its services will be employed to do legitimate online investigations, or merely to break the law on customer's behalf.
lead_paragraph: Charles Tendell, a war veteran who owns a consulting firm in Denver, says the site, Hacker’s List, grew faster than he anticipated.

headline.main: Owner of Anonymous Hackers-for-Hire Site Steps Forward
headline.print_headline: Owner Identified of Site Offering Hackers for Hire

snippet: Charles Tendell, a war veteran who owns a consulting firm in Denver, says the site, Hacker’s List, grew faster than he anticipated.
